Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the cause of the fire by stating that it was caused by residents using disinfectant against the novel coronavirus, while the investigation found that it was actually caused by a cigarette end igniting materials on the balcony.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading video and does not provide any concrete evidence or official statements to support the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the fire was caused by residents using disinfectant without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The investigation found that the fire was caused by a cigarette end igniting materials on the balcony, which is an alternative explanation to the claim that it was caused by residents using disinfectant.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the fire was not caused by alcohol disinfectant, as stated by fire officials and the investigation.
Understate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim understates any information or downplays the severity of the incident.
Falters at times: The claim falters in terms of accuracy and reliability as it is based on a misleading video and does not align with the findings of the investigation.
